org.diachron.detection.repositories

Class SesameVirtRep

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.diachron.detection.repositories.SesameVirtRep

  • public class SesameVirtRep
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains a set of methods which are used to handle Virtuoso Triple Store using Sesame API calls.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SesameVirtRep(java.util.Properties prop)
      Creates a new Virtuoso connection.
      SesameVirtRep(java.lang.String virt_instance, int port, java.lang.String usr, java.lang.String pwd)
      Creates a new Virtuoso connection using a Sesame RepositoryConnection.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SesameVirtRep

        public SesameVirtRep(java.lang.String virt_instance,
             int port,
             java.lang.String usr,
             java.lang.String pwd)
              throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        Creates a new Virtuoso connection using a Sesame RepositoryConnection.
        Parameters:
        virt_instance - The IP of the machine which hosts Virtuoso.
        port - The port.
        usr - The username of the certified user.
        pwd - The password of the certified user.
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException

      • SesameVirtRep

        public SesameVirtRep(java.util.Properties prop)
              throws org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException
        Creates a new Virtuoso connection. The credentials are taken from a properties file.
        Parameters:
        prop - The properties file instance
        Throws:
        org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryException

        Returns the number of the triples contained in the named graph given as parameter.

      • exportToFile

        public void exportToFile(java.lang.String filename,
                org.openrdf.rio.RDFFormat format,
                java.lang.String graphSource)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Exports the contents of a named graph into a file in various formats.
        Parameters:
        filename - The filename in which the export data will be stored. The filename can be either in the Virtuoso-host machine of not.
        format - The format of the exported data e.g., RDF/XML, N3, N-Triples etc.
        graphSource - The named graph whose data will be exported.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • importFile

        public void importFile(java.lang.String filename,
              org.openrdf.rio.RDFFormat format,
              java.lang.String graphDest)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Imports a file with RDF contents within Virtuoso and the named graph given as parameter.
        Parameters:
        filename - The filename which contains the data to be imported.
        format - The format of the give data e.g., RDF/XML, N3, N-Triples etc.
        graphDest - The named graph destination.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • addTriple

        public void addTriple(java.lang.String s,
             java.lang.String p,
             java.lang.String o,
             java.lang.String graph)
        Inserts a (URI) triple into a named graph.
        Parameters:
        s - The subject URI of the triple.
        p - The predicate URI of the triple.
        o - The object URI triple.
        graph - The named graph into which the triple will be inserted.

      • addLitTriple

        public void addLitTriple(java.lang.String s,
                java.lang.String p,
                java.lang.String o,
                java.lang.String graph)
        Inserts a (Literal) triple into a named graph.
        Parameters:
        s - The subject URI of the triple.
        p - The predicate URI of the triple.
        o - The string literal object of the triple.
        graph - The named graph into which the triple will be inserted.

      • addLitTriple

                double o,
                java.lang.String graph)
        Inserts a (Literal) triple into a named graph.
        Parameters:
        s - The subject URI of the triple.
        p - The predicate URI of the triple.
        o - The double literal object of the triple.
        graph - The named graph into which the triple will be inserted.
